wiki.content: "Heat Waves" was released on June 29, 2020 as the fourth single from Glass Animals’ third studio album, Dreamland. Written and produced by the band’s frontman Dave Bayley, the song was inspired by personal experiences of grief and emotional distance, particularly during the isolation of the COVID-19 pandemic. Bayley has mentioned that it was about confronting the past and dealing with feelings he had long buried. At first, the song saw modest success, but its trajectory changed dramatically in late 2020 and throughout 2021, thanks to its growing popularity on TikTok, where users began creating videos that resonated with its nostalgic and emotional tone. The song’s mellow beat and heartfelt lyrics helped it cross over from indie pop into mainstream appeal. "Heat Waves" climbed global charts slowly but steadily, eventually peaking at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 in the United States in March 2022, making it the band's first-ever chart-topper. It also topped charts in countries like Australia, where it held the number one spot for several weeks, and became a massive streaming hit—spending over 90 weeks on the Billboard Hot 100, one of the longest runs in history. Its enduring success made "Heat Waves" Glass Animals’ breakout hit, transforming them from an alt-pop favorite into a globally recognized band. It was certified platinum on April 28, 2021 making it their second song to do so. During March 12 , 2022, the song peaked at #1 on the Hot 100. It is Glass Animal's first song to appear on the chart . It also set the record for the longest climb to the top spot in chart history, taking 59 weeks to reach #1. The song also topped charts in countries like Australia, where it held the #1 position for several weeks. On April 28, 2021, it was certified platinum, making it the band’s second song to earn that certification. With over 90 weeks on the Hot 100, “Heat Waves” became a historic, record-breaking hit that elevated Glass Animals from indie-pop cult favorites to global mainstream stars. Read more on Last.fm.
